name: Noble Writ with Wax Seal
prompt: heroic tabletop fantasy (D&D 5e adjacent), grounded medieval-fantasy materials, culturally coherent gear, no modern tech or signage, consistent painterly collection style, In-world document: Noble Writ with Wax Seal, creased parchment, water damage, ink bleed, readable serif fonts; clear headings; no gibberish, microtext / cipher hints, high-res scan, aquatic fantasy realism, subsurface caustics, bioluminescent accents, pressure-dome materials, palette: teals, deep blues, sea-greens, pearl highlights, Use specified aspect/resolution; avoid artifacts., Text must be legible and non-gibberish. Favor simple, readable serif fonts, larger kerning, and clear headings. If uncertain, use short Latin-like placeholder words with proper spacing, or leave blank lines for later typesetting., Avoid garbled or random letter strings; keep any symbols meaningful or use numbered pins., Avoid sci-fi UIs, modern signage, photoreal CGI, anime style, bloom glare.
alt_text: Noble Writ with Wax Seal as an in-world paper prop.
revised_prompt: Create an image in a consistent painterly collection style, inspired by the heroic and grounded materials found in tabletop fantasy similar to Dungeons & Dragons 5e. The focus should be on a noble writ sealed with wax, displayed on creased and water-damaged parchment, with hints of ink bleed. It should contain legible text in serif fonts with clear headings and no gibberish. Microtext or cipher hints might be included, but avoid garbled or random letter strings. The document appears to be in the context of an underwater kingdom, thereby incorporating elements of aquatic fantasy realism such as subsurface caustics and bioluminescent accents. The color palette should consist mainly of teals, deep blues, sea-greens, and pearl highlights. Please avoid any elements of modern technology, modern signage, science fiction UIs, photorealistic CGI, or anime style. The text must be simple and readable, favoring larger kerning. If uncertain, the placeholder can be short Latin-like words with proper spacing, or simply, leave blank lines for later typesetting.
